page.title: 06Employment
page.content: The two main forms of employment are found in the primary or tertiary service sectors. In the southern part of the area farming is the major form of employment whilst public, community and commercial employment dominates in the northern sector. A small amount of manufacturing or storage takes place on the riverside. Employment in the primary sector accounts for 6.2% of the working population, manufacturing accounts for 2.8%, construction 4.5% and the service industry 83.6%.Truro shopping centre provides employment mostly for part-time women workers, who are below the National Insurance threshold. Also there is a small nucleus of full-time employees. Unemployment in Cornwall is 15.9%, but only 10.9% in Truro and falling, as Truro grows as the major service centre for Cornwall.
